channel.title: Seminars in theatre
channel.description:
A weekly panel discussion series on the theatre scene in New York City, moderated by Richard Pyatt.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Christmas Eve concerts at Carnegie Hall
item.description: Christmas Eve concerts at Carnegie Hall. Ted Mann, producer of Circle in the Square Theater, and Alexander Schneider, conductor
item.dc:creator: WNYC (Radio station : New York, N.Y.)
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: Theatre of Mixed Means
item.description: Richard Kostelanetz, author of "Theatre of Mixed Means" Also: Meredith Monk, dance theatre; Ken Dewey; Lawrence Kornfeld.
item.dc:creator: WNYC (Radio station : New York, N.Y.)
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: The play 'Detective'
item.description: A discussion of the play "Detective" with members of the New York City Police Department and the John Jay College of Criminal Justice. Prof. Ben Turmine; Prof. Flora Rita Schreiber; Edward P. Powers
item.dc:creator: WNYC (Radio station : New York, N.Y.)
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: The Ford Theatre in Washington, D.C.
item.description: The reconstruction and reopening of the Ford Theatre in Washington, D.C. Michael Dewell (or Duell); Jack Sidoe (or Siddough); Jay Longacre.
item.dc:creator: WNYC (Radio station : New York, N.Y.)
item.dc:subject: Washington (D.C.)

item.title: Minority theatre, part two
item.description: This program presents Douglas Turner Ward, artistic director, Negro Ensemble Company, and Loften Mitchell, author of "Black Drama", on black theatre and minority theatre.
item.dc:creator: Pyatt, Richard I., 1935-
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: Muzeeka
item.description: A discussion of "Muzeeka" with John Ware, author; Warren Lyons, producer; Peggy Pope, actress.

item.title: Endecott and the Red Cross
item.description: Members of the American Place Theatre discuss "Endecott and the Red Cross." John Hancock, director; Julie Miles (or Myles), general manager; Jack Scalessi, actor; Robert Levine, costume designer.
item.dc:creator: WNYC (Radio station : New York, N.Y.)
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: Discussion of the play "The Concept"
item.description: Discussion of the play "The Concept" performed by ex-narcotic addicts (ex-drug addicts). Arthur Kantor, co-producer; Lawrence Sakerol, director; Carol Bruce and Jimmy Costaldo, actors.
item.dc:creator: WNYC (Radio station : New York, N.Y.)
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: Fortunate Men's Eyes
item.description: About play "Fortune of Men's Eyes," (or "Fortunate Men's Eyes"), written by ex-convicts. David Rothenberg, producer; Victor Arnold, actor; Paul Jones, John Davis and Pat McCarrey (or McGarrey)
item.dc:creator: WNYC (Radio station : New York, N.Y.)
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature
